entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 10:33AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Stormy Weather Likely for Western Alaska This Weekend... A strong storm is expected to move northeast through the Bering and Chukchi Seas Friday night and into this weekend. This system will likely bring heavy snow, strong winds, blizzard conditions, and the possibly of freezing rain to areas south of the Seward Peninsula and in the lower Yukon River Valley. entry.summary: .Heavy rain continues to fall across the region with some of the rain falling on snow. This is leading to increased flows in waterways. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL IMPACT MUCH OF NATRONA COUNTY... HAZARDS...A area of heavy snow with visibility to less than a quarter mile at times is occurring across Natrona County. This band of heavy snow is producing heavy snow at the rate around 1 to 1 1/2 inches per hour. Roads and highways are slushy to snow packed or will become as the heavy snow continues.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 21 at 6:11PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Ice Jam flooding on rivers and streams possible... Ice is beginning to break up on area waterways, with ice jams reported on portions of the Yellowstone River and Powder River. With warm temperatures in the forecast, ice will begin to break up in more area waterways. As the ice breaks up it may become piled up resulting in an ice jam and localized flooding.
